instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKLT_PWM: What is BKLT_PWM? BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKLT_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
hey all

i have 3.3 coming to <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> also 5v is there feedback line is good
f7700 has 8.67v but nothing on lcd boost?

please help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Do you have image for sure?
If yes, post <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> voltage.
If not, check for USB activity.
Does it chime at least?
Post voltage on both pins of <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
100% got image boot all the way to os. Chimes!
<DIODE>D7701</DIODE> no power on both ends i checked both traces from <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> i also change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> just in case.
no voltage on <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> and <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL>

i forgot to mention this was also some waterdamage
3 area affected with visible corrosion:
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>
<CHIP>U7090</CHIP>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR>

can this be part of problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: does lcd connector must be connected for the right reading?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Of course, LCD must be detected; in order to enable backlight and image...

Post voltages for <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>/07 too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
i forgot to try with lcd after <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> replacement. i ultrasonic and test in machine its all good. everything working perfect.

thanks so much informaticos
